textBox.richText: The topic of justice and genocide is fascinating to me. How can there be any sort of justice afterwards? Yet, the world cannot simply let perpetrators go without any punishment. What is the proper course? What helps to rebuild society and benefit victims, while holding each actor accountable for their role? What should be done when a large percentage of the population was actively involved in killing? How should perpetrators be sentenced? Who should try them and where? The list, Bibliography of Justice & Genocide, is a starting point for looking at these issues more closely.
